title: Switching From a Pixel Phone to a Different Android Phone
content:
Very soon I will be switching from a Google Pixel phone to a different brand Android phone. I'm looking for advice on my plan to migrate all my apps, settings and data from the Pixel to the new Android phone.

I have removed all personal files  -- photos, music, documents of all types, wallpapers and ringtones - from the Pixel phone; they are backed up to my Google Drive.
I have backed up everything that Android makes it possible to backup.
I have separately backed up all calls and messages from all such apps.

It seems to me that all I need to do on the new Android phone is to sign in to my Google account, which will recreate everything on the new phone, and then restore my backups, and I am done.

Will this successfully migrate me to the new phone?
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel
